thread.title: Colts' QB Luck out for second game; Hasselbeck to start
thread.title_full: Colts' QB Luck out for second game; Hasselbeck to start

title: Colts' QB Luck out for second game; Hasselbeck to start
text:
Colts' QB Luck out for second game; Hasselbeck to start Updated 6:14 pm, Thursday, October 8, 2015 Photo: R Brent Smith, AP Image 1 of / 2 Close Image 1 of 2 
Indianapolis Colts' Andrew Luck watches from the sideline during the first half of an NFL football game against the Jacksonville Jaguars, Sunday, Oct. 4, 2015, in Indianapolis. Photo: R Brent Smith, AP Indianapolis Colts' Andrew Luck watches from the sideline during... Image 2 of 2 
FILE - In a Monday, Sept. 21, 2015 file photo, Indianapolis Colts quarterback Andrew Luck (12) throws against the New York Jets in the first half of an NFL football game in Indianapolis. Luck is inactive on Sunday, Oct. 4, 2015, and will miss his first NFL game because of a right shoulder injury. Photo: AJ Mast, AP FILE - In a Monday, Sept. 21, 2015 file photo, Indianapolis Colts... Colts' QB Luck out for second game; Hasselbeck to start 1 / 2 Back to Gallery HOUSTON (AP) â€” Indianapolis quarterback Andrew Luck was inactive on Thursday night against the Houston Texans because of a right shoulder injury. It will be the second straight game Luck has sat out after not missing a game in his career before last week. Matt Hasselbeck will start in his place in a matchup of AFC South foes. The 40-year-old Hasselbeck threw for 282 yards with one touchdown in a 16-13 overtime win over the Jaguars on Sunday. Josh Johnson will be Hasselbeck's backup. Inactive for the Texans are receivers Nate Washington (hamstring) and Cecil Shorts (shoulder). ___ AP NFL website: www.pro32.ap.org and http://twitter.com/AP_NFL Southeast Texas sports news
